h2d.Anim.name: Anim
h2d.Anim.description: Displays an animated sequence of bitmap Tiles on the screen.

h2d.BasicElement.name: BasicElement
h2d.BasicElement.description: A simple BatchElement that provides primitive simulation of velocity, friction and gravity.

h2d.BatchElement.name: BatchElement
h2d.BatchElement.description: A base class for SpriteBatch elements which can be extended with custom logic.

h2d.Bitmap.name: Bitmap
h2d.Bitmap.description: Displays a single bitmap Tile on the screen.

h2d.Camera.name: Camera
h2d.Camera.description: A 2D camera representation attached to h2d.Scene.

h2d.CdbLevel.name: CdbLevel
h2d.CdbLevel.description:
A decoder and renderer for levels created with the CastleDB 2D level editor.
See http://castledb.org for more details.

h2d.CheckBox.name: CheckBox
h2d.CheckBox.description: A simple Interactive checkbox button with a label.

h2d.Drawable.name: Drawable
h2d.Drawable.description: A base class for all 2D objects that will draw something on the screen.

h2d.Dropdown.name: Dropdown
h2d.Dropdown.description: A simple UI component that creates an interactive drop-down list.

h2d.Font.name: Font
h2d.Font.description: An instance of a text font.

h2d.Graphics.name: Graphics
h2d.Graphics.description: A simple interface to draw arbitrary 2D geometry.

h2d.Kerning.name: Kerning
h2d.Kerning.description: A FontChar kerning information as well as linked list of kernings. See FontChar.kerning.

h2d.KeyFrames.name: KeyFrames
h2d.KeyFrames.description: Adobe After effect player, see Keyframes library.

h2d.LevelGroup.name: LevelGroup
h2d.LevelGroup.description: CastleDB integration; A part of CdbLevel decoder.

h2d.LevelLayer.name: LevelLayer
h2d.LevelLayer.description: CastleDB integration; A part of CdbLevel decoder.

h2d.LevelObject.name: LevelObject
h2d.LevelObject.description: CastleDB integration; A part of CdbLevel decoder.

h2d.LevelObjectInstance.name: LevelObjectInstance
h2d.LevelObjectInstance.description: CastleDB integration; A part of CdbLevel decoder.

h2d.LevelTileset.name: LevelTileset
h2d.LevelTileset.description: CastleDB integration; A part of CdbLevel decoder.

h2d.Mask.name: Mask
h2d.Mask.description:
Restricts rendering area within the [width, height] rectangle.
For more advanced masking, see h2d.filter.AbstractMask.

h2d.Object.name: Object
h2d.Object.description: A base 2D class that all scene tree elements inherit from.

h2d.ObjectFollower.name: ObjectFollower
h2d.ObjectFollower.description: Follows the 3D object position in current 3D camera, synchronizing the follower position to projected 2D position of the followed object.

h2d.ParticleGroup.name: ParticleGroup
h2d.ParticleGroup.description: An emitter of a single particle group. Part of Particles simulation system.

h2d.Particles.name: Particles
h2d.Particles.description: A 2D particle system with wide range of customizability.

h2d.Scene.name: Scene
h2d.Scene.description: The root class for a 2D scene. All root objects are added to it before being drawn on screen.

h2d.Slider.name: Slider
h2d.Slider.description: A simple interactive horizontal numerical slider.

h2d.Text.name: Text
h2d.Text.description: A basic text renderer with multiline support.

h2d.Tile.name: Tile
h2d.Tile.description: A core 2D rendering component representing a region of an underlying h3d.mat.Texture.

h2d.Video.name: Video
h2d.Video.description: A video file playback Drawable. Due to platform specifics, each target have their own limitations.

h2d.ZGroup.name: ZGroup
h2d.ZGroup.description: An advanced double-pass rendering class that utilizes a z-culling on an opaque objects.

h2d.BlendMode.name: BlendMode
h2d.BlendMode.description: The blending rules when rendering a Tile/Material.

h2d.FontType.name: FontType
h2d.FontType.description: The rendering type of the of the Font instance.

h2d.ImageVerticalAlign.name: ImageVerticalAlign
h2d.ImageVerticalAlign.description: HtmlText img tag vertical alignment rules.

h2d.LevelLayerData.name: LevelLayerData
h2d.LevelLayerData.description: CastleDB integration; A part of CdbLevel decoder.

h2d.LineHeightMode.name: LineHeightMode
h2d.LineHeightMode.description: The HtmlText line height calculation rules.

h2d.PartEmitMode.name: PartEmitMode
h2d.PartEmitMode.description: The particle emission pattern modes. See ParticleGroup.emitMode.

h2d.ScaleModeAlign.name: ScaleModeAlign
h2d.ScaleModeAlign.description: Viewport alignment when scaling mode supports it. See ScaleMode.

h2d.ConsoleArgDesc.name: ConsoleArgDesc
h2d.ConsoleArgDesc.description: A descriptor for an argument of a console command.

h2d.KeyframesLayer.name: KeyframesLayer
h2d.KeyframesLayer.description: Keyframes integration; A KeyFrames animation layer.

h2d.LayerSpec.name: LayerSpec
h2d.LayerSpec.description: CastleDB integration; A part of CdbLevel decoder.

h2d.LevelSpec.name: LevelSpec
h2d.LevelSpec.description: CastleDB integration; A part of CdbLevel decoder.

h2d.TileSpec.name: TileSpec
h2d.TileSpec.description: CastleDB integration; A part of CdbLevel decoder.

h3d.Vector.name: Vector
h3d.Vector.description: A 4 floats vector. Everytime a Vector is returned, it means a copy is created.

hxd.App.name: App
hxd.App.description: Base class for a Heaps application.

hxd.ByteConversions.name: ByteConversions
hxd.ByteConversions.description: Tries to provide consistent access to haxe.io.bytes from any primitive

hxd.Rand.name: Rand
hxd.Rand.description: hxd.Rand is a seeded random number generator, that allows to get always the same results starting from a given seed.

hxd.Save.name: Save
hxd.Save.description:
Save provides simple interface to save and load serialized user data.
Data is serialized to String with haxe.Serializer and then stored in text form.

hxd.Timer.name: Timer
hxd.Timer.description:
The Timer class acts as a global time measurement that can be accessed from various parts of the engine.
These three values are representation of the same underlying calculus: tmod, dt, fps

hxsl.Checker.name: Checker
hxsl.Checker.description: Type Checker : will take an untyped Expr and turn it into a typed TExpr, resolving identifiers and ensuring type safety.

hxsl.Eval.name: Eval
hxsl.Eval.description:
Evaluator : will substitute some variables (usually constants) by their runtime value and will
evaluate and reduce the expression, unroll loops, etc.

h2d.col.Bounds.name: Bounds
h2d.col.Bounds.description: A 2D bounding box often used for determining Object bounding area.

h2d.col.Cell.name: Cell
h2d.col.Cell.description: The resulting cell inside the Voronoi diagram.

h2d.col.Circle.name: Circle
h2d.col.Circle.description: The circular hitbox implementation of a 2D Collider.

h2d.col.Collider.name: Collider
h2d.col.Collider.description: A common interface for 2D Shapes to hit-test again the mouse or a specific point in space.

h2d.col.Delaunay.name: Delaunay
h2d.col.Delaunay.description: A Delaunay triangulation utility. See Delaunay.triangulate.

h2d.col.DelaunayTriangle.name: DelaunayTriangle
h2d.col.DelaunayTriangle.description: The resulting triangle of a Delaunay triangulation operation.

h2d.col.Diagram.name: Diagram
h2d.col.Diagram.description: The resulting diagram of the Voronoi.compute.

h2d.col.Edge.name: Edge
h2d.col.Edge.description: The resulting edge inside the Voronoi diagram.

h2d.col.Halfedge.name: Halfedge
h2d.col.Halfedge.description: The edge attached to a Voronoi Cell.

h2d.col.Line.name: Line
h2d.col.Line.description: An infinite 2D line going through two specified Points.

h2d.col.PixelsCollider.name: PixelsCollider
h2d.col.PixelsCollider.description: An hxd.Pixels-based collider. Checks for pixel color value under point to be above the cutoff value.

h2d.col.PolygonCollider.name: PolygonCollider
h2d.col.PolygonCollider.description: A Collider wrapper around Polygons to enable using those for hit-testing testing.

h2d.col.Ray.name: Ray
h2d.col.Ray.description: A raycast from the given position in a specified direction.

h2d.col.RoundRect.name: RoundRect
h2d.col.RoundRect.description: A Collider representing the rectangle with the rounded edges, forming a 2D capsule.

h2d.col.Voronoi.name: Voronoi
h2d.col.Voronoi.description: A Steven Fortune's algorithm to compute Voronoi diagram from given set of Points and a bounding box.

h2d.col.IPolygon.name: IPolygon
h2d.col.IPolygon.description: An abstract around an Array of IPoints that define a polygonal shape that can be collision-tested against.

h2d.col.IPolygons.name: IPolygons
h2d.col.IPolygons.description: An abstract over an Array of IPolygon instances that define multiple polygonal shapes that can be collision-tested against.

h2d.col.Polygon.name: Polygon
h2d.col.Polygon.description: An abstract around an Array of Points that define a polygonal shape that can be collision-tested against.

h2d.col.Polygons.name: Polygons
h2d.col.Polygons.description: An abstract over an Array of Polygon instances that define multiple polygonal shapes that can be collision-tested against.

h2d.col.Segments.name: Segments
h2d.col.Segments.description: An abstract over the list of Segments. Alternative representation of a polygon.

h2d.col.OffsetKind.name: OffsetKind
h2d.col.OffsetKind.description: The type of the edges when offsetting polygon with IPolygon.offset.

h2d.filter.AbstractMask.name: AbstractMask
h2d.filter.AbstractMask.description: A base class for filters that utilize separate Objects as a masking object.

h2d.filter.Ambient.name: Ambient
h2d.filter.Ambient.description: A ColorMatrix filer that applies color correction depending on the masked area.

h2d.filter.Bloom.name: Bloom
h2d.filter.Bloom.description:
Applies a bloom effect to the filtered Object.
Produces feathers to light areas in the objects.

h2d.filter.Blur.name: Blur
h2d.filter.Blur.description: Utilizes the h3d.pass.Blur render pass to perform a blurring operation on the filtered object.

h2d.filter.ColorMatrix.name: ColorMatrix
h2d.filter.ColorMatrix.description: Applies a color correction filter based on the provided matrix.

h2d.filter.Displacement.name: Displacement
h2d.filter.Displacement.description: Applies a normal map to the filtered Object in order to displace pixels.

h2d.filter.DropShadow.name: DropShadow
h2d.filter.DropShadow.description: Adds a soft shadow to the filtered Object.

h2d.filter.Filter.name: Filter
h2d.filter.Filter.description: The base filter class, you can extend it in order to define your own filters, although ShaderFilter will be the most straightforward way to define simple custom filter.

h2d.filter.Glow.name: Glow
h2d.filter.Glow.description: Adds a glow backdrop to the filtered Object.

h2d.filter.Group.name: Group
h2d.filter.Group.description: Applies an array of Filters to a single Object with several limitations.

h2d.filter.Mask.name: Mask
h2d.filter.Mask.description: Performs an arbitrary shape masking of the filtered Object.

h2d.filter.Outline.name: Outline
h2d.filter.Outline.description: Provides a solid color outline to the filtered object by utilizing h3d.pass.Outline render pass.

h2d.filter.Shader.name: Shader
h2d.filter.Shader.description: The base class for simple filters that don't need specialized render passes and rely completely on the shaders.

h2d.impl.BatchDrawState.name: BatchDrawState
h2d.impl.BatchDrawState.description: Automates buffer segmentation when rendering 2D geometry with multiple unique textures.

h2d.impl.GenPointApi.name: GenPointApi
h2d.impl.GenPointApi.description: A base common API interface for the points to validate API parity between 3D and 2D classes.

h2d.impl.IPointApi.name: IPointApi
h2d.impl.IPointApi.description: A common API interface for the integer Points to validate API parity between 3D and 2D classes.

h2d.impl.PointApi.name: PointApi
h2d.impl.PointApi.description: A common API interface for the floating-point Points to validate API parity between 3D and 2D classes.

h3d.col.HeightMap.name: HeightMap
h3d.col.HeightMap.description:
This is an helper class to define a heightmap-based collider.
In order to use, you need to extends this class and override the getZ method
in order to return appropriate Z value based on X and Y coordinates.

h3d.mat.DepthBuffer.name: DepthBuffer
h3d.mat.DepthBuffer.description: Depth buffer are used to store per pixel depth information when rendering a scene (also called Z-buffer)

h3d.prim.BigPrimitive.name: BigPrimitive
h3d.prim.BigPrimitive.description:
Vertex buffers are limited to 65K vertexes because of the 16-bits limitation of the index buffers.
BigPrimitive allows you to easily create large buffers by spliting the buffers.

h3d.prim.Primitive.name: Primitive
h3d.prim.Primitive.description:
h3d.prim.Primitive is the base class for all 3D primitives.
You can't create an instance of it and need to use one of its subclasses.

h3d.scene.Mesh.name: Mesh
h3d.scene.Mesh.description:
h3d.scene.Mesh is the base class for all 3D objects displayed on screen.
Unlike Object base class, all properties of Mesh only apply to the current object and are not inherited by its children.

h3d.scene.MeshBatch.name: MeshBatch
h3d.scene.MeshBatch.description:
h3d.scene.MeshBatch allows to draw multiple meshed in a single draw call.
See samples/MeshBatch.hx for an example.

h3d.scene.Object.name: Object
h3d.scene.Object.description:
h3d.scene.Object is the base 3D class that all scene tree elements inherit from.
It can be used to create a virtual container that does not display anything but can contain other objects
so the various transforms are inherited to its children.

h3d.scene.Scene.name: Scene
h3d.scene.Scene.description: h3d.scene.Scene is the root class for a 3D scene. All root objects are added to it before being drawn on screen.

h3d.shader.SAO.name: SAO
h3d.shader.SAO.description:
Screen space ambient occlusion.
Uses "Scalable Ambient Obscurance" [McGuire12]

h3d.shader.Texture2.name: Texture2
h3d.shader.Texture2.description: This is similar to [Texture] shader but uses a second UV set.

hxd.res.BDFFont.name: BDFFont
hxd.res.BDFFont.description: Parse BDF font format to h2d.Font

hxd.res.BDFFontChar.name: BDFFontChar
hxd.res.BDFFontChar.description:
Intermediate representation of a glyph. Only used while
parsing a BDF font file.

hxd.res.Font.name: Font
hxd.res.Font.description:
Allows to build a font bitmap to be used by h2d.Text. Only some platforms support such runtime Font building
and the result in terms of font quality, antialiasing, etc might vary depending on the platform.
It is recommended to use offline BitmapFont instead, read https://heaps.io/documentation/text.html

hxd.res.FontBuilder.name: FontBuilder
hxd.res.FontBuilder.description:
FontBuilder allows to dynamicaly create a Bitmap font from a vector font.
Depending on the platform this might require the font to be available as part of the resources,
or it can be embedded manually with hxd.res.Embed.embedFont

hxd.snd.webaudio.Context.name: Context
hxd.snd.webaudio.Context.description: Common part between webaudio and OpenAL emulator - AudioContext and masterGain.
